keyTakeAways: The oldest Israeli hostage taken on October 7, 2023, was Arye Zalmanovich, aged 85, who was reportedly killed in captivity on November 17, 2023.
Tamir Adar, a 38-year-old from Kibbutz Nir Oz, died defending his community on October 7, 2023, and his body was taken to Gaza before being returned to Israel.
The return of the two deceased hostages marks the 14th and 15th such bodies transferred under the ceasefire agreement, with 28 in total required to be returned by Hamas.
Hamas has claimed that significant efforts and special equipment are needed to recover bodies buried under rubble or lost in Gaza, raising concerns about the feasibility of full compliance.
One of the bodies handed over by Hamas was not an Israeli hostage, indicating possible misidentification, which undermines trust in the recovery process.
US Vice President JD Vance emphasized that returning the bodies is a priority, but acknowledged it is not going to happen overnight, stressing the difficulty of locating and retrieving the missing.
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) have called for public sensitivity and official identification before informing families, to prevent misinformation and trauma.

summaryOfNewsArticle: On October 21, 2025, the Israel Defense Forces identified and received the remains of two deceased hostages taken during the Hamas attack on October 7, 2023: Arye Zalmanovich, the oldest hostage (85 years old), who was killed in captivity, and Tamir Adar, a 38-year-old who died defending his kibbutz. Their return marks the 14th and 15th deceased hostages to be handed over under the US-proposed ceasefire agreement, which requires Hamas to return all 28 deceased hostages within 72 hours. Hamas has cited logistical challenges, including rubble and misidentifications, as obstacles to full compliance. The US Vice President, JD Vance, emphasized the moral imperative to recover the bodies, while acknowledging the difficulty and that progress will not be overnight. The IDF is urging public sensitivity and official identification before informing families.
title: Oldest Hostage Taken on October 7 Among Two Deceased Returned to Israel on October 21, 2025
